text: Bzhedugkhabl () is a rural locality (an aul) in Sadovskoye Rural Settlement of Krasnogvardeysky District, Adygea, Russia. The population was 1041 as of 2018. There are 16 streets. == Geography == The aul is located 20 km south-east from Krasnogvardeyskoye, on the bank of the Belaya. == Ethnicity == The aul is inhabited by Russian, Kurds, Armenians, Adygeis, Ukrainians and Greeks. == References == Category:Rural localities in Krasnogvardeysky District
title: Bzhedugkhabl
